column3: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
The terrorists thought they would change my aims and stop my ambitions, but nothing changed in my life except this: weakness, fear and hopelessness died. Strength, power and courage were born.
Life changes so quickly. feeling grateful to be around such wonderful people to strengthen and grow with.
I believe alien life is quite common in the universe, although intelligent life is less so. Some say it has yet to appear on planet Earth.
Life is one grand, sweet song, so start the music.
Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul.
Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.
One of the most important days of my life was when I learned to ride a bicycle.
Life doesn't require that we be the best, only that we try our best.
I am God's vessel. But my greatest pain in life is that I will never be able to see myself perform live.
Life moves so fast. You gotta document the good times, man.
You have to enjoy life. Always be surrounded by people that you like, people who have a nice conversation. There are so many positive things to think about.
I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches.

People think my life has been tough, but I think has been a wonderful journey. The older you get, the more you realise it's not what happens, but how you deal with it.
People fear death even more than pain. It's strange that they fear death. Life hurts a lot more than death. At the point of death, the pain is over. Yeah, I guess it is a friend.

The higher the hill, the stronger the wind: so the loftier the life, the stronger the enemy's temptations.

If you live long enough, you'll make mistakes. But if you learn from them, you'll be a better person. It's how you handle adversity, not how it affects you. The main thing is never quit, never quit, never quit.
Over and over I marvel at the blessings of my life: Each year has grown better than the last.
Too often we underestimate the power of a touch, a smile, a kind word, a listening ear, an honest compliment, or the smallest act of caring, all of which have the potential to turn a life around.
